name: 6_Error_Example_OutputName
content:
library(shiny)
Sys.setenv(LANG = "en")

## In this example we cause an issue on purpose to illustrate common mistakes
## with shiny

## In detail we show:
## * that not always an error is triggered but functionality still not given.

## The app should take a text from the user and outputs it as a text. This is
## not working since the IDs do not match correctly since we inserted a typo.



ui <- fluidPage(
  textInput(inputId = "MyText",
            label = "My text input: "),
  
  textOutput(outputId = "NiceOutput")
)

server <- function(input, output, session) {
  

  ## We switch the "i" with a "1" in the output name "NiceOutput".
  output$N1ceOutput <- renderText({
    paste0("You entered the following text: ", input$MyText)
  })
  
  ## The following would work
  # output$NiceOutput <- renderText({
  #   paste0("You entered the following text: ", input$MyText)
  # })
  
}

shinyApp(ui, server)
## no error message triggered, but intended functionality not provided
## Lesson to learn: be precise with the IDs
